\chapter{\sphinxstylestrong{Developer Manual}}
\label{\detokenize{developer:developer-manual}}\label{\detokenize{developer::doc}}

\section{\sphinxstyleemphasis{Software Requirements}}
\label{\detokenize{developer:software-requirements}}
The following softwares are needed to be installed:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Python3

\end{itemize}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
tkinter

\item {} 
openepyxl

\end{itemize}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Sphinx

\end{itemize}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{sudo} \PYG{n}{apt}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{get} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{python3}
\PYG{n}{sudo} \PYG{n}{apt}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{get} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{python3}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{tk}
\PYG{n}{pip3} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{pyexcel}
\PYG{n}{pip3} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{xlwt}
\PYG{n}{pip3} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{xlsxwriter}
\PYG{n}{pip3} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{xlrd}
\PYG{n}{pip3} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{openpyxl}
\PYG{n}{pip3} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{ezodf}
\PYG{n}{pip3} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{python}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{docx}
\PYG{n}{pip3} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{pyexcel}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{ods}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Sphinx installation in needed in case you want to work on the documentation

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{pip} \PYG{n}{install} \PYG{n}{sphinx}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

Note that to compile the changes made to the documentation you have to move to the docs folder and compile your changes

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{cd} \PYG{n}{docs}\PYG{o}{/}
\PYG{n}{make} \PYG{n}{html}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

The file will be changes in the \sphinxstyleemphasis{build/html} folder

For more information on working with sphinx you can refer:
\sphinxurl{https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/index.html}


\section{\sphinxstyleemphasis{Bug Reports and Feature Requests}}
\label{\detokenize{developer:bug-reports-and-feature-requests}}
If you have encontered a problem with the application or have an idea for a new feature, please submit it as an issue tracker on Github.

After getting approval from a moderator, you may make a pull requests to the repository.


\section{\sphinxstyleemphasis{Contributing on the Project}}
\label{\detokenize{developer:contributing-on-the-project}}
The recommended way for new contributors to submit code to Sphinx is to fork the repository on GitHub and then submit a pull request after committing the changes. The pull request will then need to be approved by one of the core developers before it is merged into the main repository.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Clone the Repository

\item {} 
Working on any of the given modules:

\end{enumerate}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
GUI\#1

\item {} 
GUI\#2

\item {} 
Documentation

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Getting Started}
\label{\detokenize{developer:getting-started}}
These are the basic steps needed to start developing on the application.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Create a Github Account.

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{Got to the given link}] \leavevmode
\sphinxurl{https://github.com/PS-Ddevil/Time-table-assist-tool}

\end{description}

\item {} 
Click on the fork option to make a copy of the repo on your profile

\end{enumerate}

\noindent{\hspace*{\fill}\sphinxincludegraphics[width=0.800\linewidth]{{Fork1}.png}\hspace*{\fill}}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{3}
\item {} 
Go to a desired location on you local system(PC).

\item {} 
Open the terminal by pressing \sphinxstyleemphasis{Alt+Ctrl+T}

\item {} 
Run the command

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{clone} \PYG{n}{https}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{github}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{com}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{n}{git}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{username}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}\PYG{o}{/}\PYG{n}{Time}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{table}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{assist}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{tool}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{git}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

where \textless{}git-username\textgreater{} refers to the Username of your Github profile
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{6}
\item {} 
Check out the branch to work on. By default the master branch in selected.

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{checkout} \PYG{n}{v2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{7}
\item {} 
To create a new branch to work on.

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{checkout} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{b} \PYG{n}{branch}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{name}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{8}
\item {} 
Incase you fix some issue you can commit the changes.

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{commit} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{m} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Some XYZ changes}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{9}
\item {} 
Push changes in the branch to your forked reposiory on the Github.

\end{enumerate}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{push} \PYG{n}{origin} \PYG{n}{branch}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{name}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\setcounter{enumi}{10}
\item {} 
Submit a pull request from your branch to the respective branch (master or X.Y).

\item {} 
Wait for a core developer to review your changes.

\end{enumerate}

\subsection{Working with Landing GUI}
\label{\detokenize{developer:working-with-landing-gui}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
Move to the cloned the folder
\begin{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{cd} \PYG{n}{Time}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{table}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{assist}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{tool}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
Open the \sphinxstyleemphasis{main.py} file.
\begin{quote}

Open the \sphinxstyleemphasis{main.py} file in any text editor of your choice

For Sublime Editor:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{subl} \PYG{n}{main}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

For Atom Editor:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{atom} \PYG{n}{main}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

For Visual Studio Code:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{code} \PYG{n}{main}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
There are three broad sections in the code

\end{enumerate}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Fuction for different GUI

\item {} 
GUI Development

\end{itemize}

SECTION 1:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Including the files for different GUIs}

\section{\sphinxstyleemphasis{Core Developers}}
\label{\detokenize{developer:core-developers}}
The core developers of the application have write access to the main repository. They can commit changes, accept/reject pull requests, and manage items on the issue tracker.

You do not need to be a core developer or have write access to be involved in the development of the application. You can submit patches or create pull requests from forked repositories and have a core developer add the changes for you.

The following are some general guidelines for core developers:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Questionable or extensive changes should be submitted as a pull request instead of being committed directly to the main repository. The pull request should be reviewed by another core developer before it is merged.

\item {} 
Trivial changes can be committed directly but be sure to keep the repository in a good working state and that all tests pass before pushing your changes.

\item {} 
When committing code written by someone else, please attribute the original author in the commit message and any relevant CHANGES entry.

\end{itemize}


\section{\sphinxstyleemphasis{Branch Model}}
\label{\detokenize{developer:branch-model}}
The branch are made when a new major portion is added into the application. Only minor changes and bug removal in the branch would be appretiated.


\subsection{Conventions}
\label{\detokenize{developer:conventions}}

\subsubsection{master:}
\label{\detokenize{developer:master}}
The is the most recent branch and the one which is currently deployed for the consumer.


\subsubsection{X.Y:}
\label{\detokenize{developer:x-y}}
Where X.Y stands for the MAJOR.MINOR release.


\subsubsection{X.Y.Z:}
\label{\detokenize{developer:x-y-z}}
Where X.Y.Z stands for MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH release.
